definition.value: A subject (ResearchSubject) who is not able to take part in the ResearchStudy. examples: subject has moved away; subject cannot drive and therefore unable to participate, etc.
A subject (ResearchSubject) is refusing to take part in the ResearchStudy. Note: Subject refusal is a synonymous term and is used in some studies.
The failure of a potential subject (potential Research Subject) of meeting one or more criteria required for participation in a trial.
A subject (Research Subject) has finished the planned protocol-specified treatment phase.
A subject (Research Subject) has finished the planned protocol-specified follow-up phase.

A subject (Research Subject) who has experienced any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.
A subject (Research Subject) has revoked permission to participate in the study or one or more components of the study.
A subject (Research Subject) has failed to follow medical advice, take medication as directed, or adhere to a prescribed course of treatment.
